Posts.Content: Janet23 wrote: It's taken me the better part of a month to get in for a diagnostic mammogram (booked for Mar 11). A month ago both my breasts got a hot, red localized rash on the lower outer quadrants after my armpits and breasts had been extremely sore for a couple weeks. The rash was incredibly itchy. Following an unrelated surgery I was given 100 mg of prednisone to control the symptoms of my systemic lupus and the rash almost went away. However, I still have areolar thickening, and the lower edge of both areola seems to have become less distinct. I also have scaly, dry and pink skin where it used to be quite red. I have new dimples in both breasts. I stopped trying to wear my bras about 3 weeks ago because they now leave "seam marks" on both my breasts. I haven't gained weight, so my boobs must be "puffy"!!  Because both breasts are affected, and because I have systemic lupus, I've had to fight to get anyone to take this seriously and not just put it down to being contact dermatitis or lupus-related. I moved to the city I'm in five months ago and because I don't work, I really have nobody here that I know. I came looking for a good forum for support and stumbled across this one. I've been really impressed with what I've read - seems like a family atmosphere prevails. As I sit here, really sore in that chubby part that overflows the bra cup between the breast and the armpit on both sides (my right side looks swollen in this area, too), I am very scared, anxious, and having a hard time concentrating on doing anything of any value with my day. If anyone can say anything that might let me know I'm not alone, I'd sure appreciate it. Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2011 11:35PM Janet23 wrote: Thanks, mdoak! I agree that it sounds suspicious for IBC, and I'm reasonably certain that my current prednisone is masking some of what would otherwise be more obvious skin symptoms (redness & peau d'orange). I'm actually going to be seen at Diagnostic Radiology at our local hospital, which is also the oncology centre  for where I live, so I know nothing about what is done for followup, when I get results, whether I get to talk to anyone. Part of my fear is that if nothing shows up on the mammograms they're going to dismiss me out of hand, and then I don't know how I push to get in to the surgeon for punch biopsies. I guess I just squeak and squeak until they decide to grease the wheel....meantime the uncertainty is just so frustrating, for me and for my husband, too. Another part of the fear is that if nothing shows up they'll just blame all these changes on my systemic lupus and walk away. In 23 years of having lupus and in all my research I've not ever read of breast or lymphatic symptoms, so that's not going to wash with me, but again, I'll have to squeak to get the grease. I find it terrifying to read how long women are waiting for diagnostic procedures. I'm praying that, living in Canada, our public health care speeds this process up, but I honestly have no idea. My sister had a lumpectomy last year but told nobody in the family anything about it, so I don't know how long everything took for her. The worry is just so all-consuming that I'm feeling rather like a zombie - just going through the motions of the day without actually participating. Thanks again for writing to me. I'll let you know what happens, and I'll DEFINITELY be back to blubber Hugs, Janet
